page.title: 01Longhorsley
page.content: A wide agricultural area with small village community until early 80s when estate of 50 houses built. Families mostly from outside the district, some of whom are being absorbed into village life. Linden Hall, formerly a private house set in beautiful wooded grounds opened as a hotel in 1981, is now prestigious 4 star hotel, and helps to ensure employment. Separate pub in grounds serves mid day and evening meals. Anglican, Roman Catholic and Mission churches are well atteneded The Church of England School attended by children up to 9 years from Longhorsley and Netherwitton. Other children bused to Morpeth schools . Shops, butcher, 2 general dealers (one a newsagent, other Post Office) and a clothing shop. One pub, an agricultural drainage business,
